Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a specific land habitat and include a variety of living things found there, such as trees, grasses, or animals like lizards and ants.
The student can draw a specific water habitat and include a variety of living things found there, such as fish, clams, or plants.
The student can label or depict patterns that show differences and similarities among living things in different habitats.
The student can use the drawing to compare how plant and animal diversity differs between a land habitat and a water habitat.
The student can visually present evidence of observations made, showing the diversity of life across the depicted habitats.
